originalText.plaidHtml:
I will be very short and direct, fantastic movie. Go watch it with your friends. All those people with 1 star and 2-star reviews are mostly from Pakistani fans living in India, Bangladesh and USA who don't want to expose their nature.

More into the film, music was great, everyone was acting phenomenally, can't wait for part 2.

summary.originalText: EASILY THE BEST AND HARDCORE RAW SPY FILM BY INDIA WITH STYLE

originalText.plaidHtml:
IF YOU LOVE YOUR COUNTRY AND ITS ARMY , YOU WILL LOVE THIS. NO HATE OR PROPAGANDA. BASED ON TRUE EVENTS THAT HURT INDIA.

3HR 30 MINS OF SHEER BRAVERY AND COURAGE.

TOO MUCH HATRED GOING ON, SO I THOUGHT OF POSTING THIS.

RANVEER SINGH,AKSHAYE KHANNA,SANJAY DUTT,ARJUN RAMPAL,MADAHAVAN,ADITHYA DHAR HATS OFF!!!!

ENOUGH OF THOSE CIRCUS SPY CLOWNS.

Absolutely high octane film. Great world building, even better music integration with mix of retro and new music. Great performances from almost everyone. But above all great direction from Aditya Dhar. He is in his on league now. There is a scene in the movie which takes you away from the movie into the reality and slaps you really hard ( and that is a good thing). In short, a must watch in theatres specifically.

summary.originalText: Extra-Ordinary !!! The real Definition of Spy Thriller !!!

originalText.plaidHtml:
Absolutely amazing movie by Aditya Dhar. Acting performances ar just out-standing..story,screenplay,action...al 10 on 10 !!!

This one is one of the most perfect and brilliantly made film ever made in bollywood !!!

Best film of 2025!

Filmmakers should take learn something after watching it.

Can't get through it so easily... Speechless !!!

It's a brilliant movie no doubt. Great direction, strong performances, and impressive attention to detail. Akshaye Khanna is outstanding, especially given how challenging his character is. The mannerisms he adopts are spot-on and elevate the role even further. Ranveer Singh is solid and fits his character well. R. Madhavan appears in a look none of us could've ever imagined! He truly is a gem of an actor.

Sanjay Dutt, in my opinion, felt unnecessary. His humour doesn't land, and his character could've easily been removed, though I suppose they wanted someone with a personal agenda against Akshaye Khanna. Rakesh Bedi was excellent in his role, while the new girl could've performed better. Gaurav Gera was another surprise! None of us would've pictured him in that kind of getup.

The most powerful aspect of the film is how starkly it portrays the gory reality of terrorists - how they think, operate, and inflict fear and "enjoy" watching innocent people die :( It also highlights the immense pressure, pain and challenges the Indian government faces during terrifying times like terrorist attacks.

The movie could easily have been 30-40 minutes shorter. Some of the action sequences are too graphic and difficult to watch. I've rated it a 7 primarily because of the excessive gore and the entire Sanjay Dutt segment.

Once again, Akshaye Khanna shines the brightest! He truly deserves multiple accolades for this role. Salute for portraying such a complex character with so much depth and dedication!

Hats off to the entire team and crew. It's difficult to not clap for their extreme hard work in making this film!

The songs and cinematography incline towards getting inspired or carry oneself as a goon like toxic personality. The viral song of the movie running all across social media glamorizes and is subliminally loaded via song choice and shooting to imitate and idolize Rehman Dakait in the mindset of the viewer. The same has been thoroughly, cleverly and covertly implemented in the movie.

Patriotism etc have been used up as cover and not impactfully emphasized in the movie presentation.

Definitely, not a recommended movie for anyone considering the distorted effect it creates on viewer's mind under false identity of patriotism.

We needed such movies 15-20 years back as well to see the reality but glad its here now. So Glad to see such movie portraying what we saw in reality in our life. Planning to watch again. Waiting to see more such attempts.

Go and take ur family memebers and friends to see it. Specially the young generation need to see what has been happening with us.

Making a movie of 3+ hours and keeping each one of the audience glued to their seat is not easy. The movie is art, the cast is perfect, you will eventually love villains here, the story, the dialogues , everything is just perfect. They have captured many terror attacks happened upon india so well you get goosebumps. Man i loved it!

Dhulandar is a solid entertainer with great acting engaging scenes and a story that keeps you hooked from start to finish it has the perfect mix of action emotion and fun making it a movie worth watching some people give useless negative reviews but dont listen to them go watch it yourself and you will see how good and enjoyable this film truly is.

A movie that will surely change the style of bollywood movies. Bollywood had become stale and ki nd of boring with its standard film making style. Sometimes it doesn't even feel like film makers are putting an effort in the craft. This movie is going to increase the standard of film making itself. It doesn't shy away from using blood and gore to maximize the impact of art of storytelling. A must watch.

From start to finish, the film meticulously constructs a high-stakes, morally complex world. Ranveer Singh anchors the narrative with a performance full of subtlety and intensity. Sanjay Dutt brings gravitas and menace, while Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan provide intelligent, layered support. Arjun Rampal's quiet threat contrasts with Sara Arjun's emotionally resonant presence. Aditya Dhar's direction ensures that suspense, action, and character arcs intertwine seamlessly. Cinematography captures both chaotic urban environments and intimate human moments. The score underscores tension, and by the climax, the story delivers thrilling and emotional payoff.

summary.originalText: As a Pakistani I still liked it

originalText.plaidHtml:
One of the best movie after long time ,I almost forget when I was the last good Bollywood movie I watched ,and here it was .i watched for akshey khana and sanjay dutt ,later found out ranbhir Singh did great acting too.feom start till end movie was to the point .they way akshey acting was on baloch was mind blowing and ch Aslam (sanajey)wow .

It looked ch is back to life .director did great great job the way they show liyari,balochistan and same clothing style was surprising good .

Many people will say it's Anti Pakistan,but it isn't .

Its shows our (can't say the name )but the real face .

Not sure will be watching next part bcs theee won't be akshey .but still hates of to the director.

What an engaging and intellectual watch!!! It is a true espionage film not garbage served in the name of YRF spy universe. There is no "hero worshipping", jingoism or unrealistic stuff. The director has not only directed very well but written very well as well and there has been though that has gone in the writing of the film. And what acting!!!!!! Each and every character in the film is very well ena ted and directed - brings the movie to life.

Highly recommended!! Auras are re-defined by each and every character in the film. Music is fantabulous!!! Crazy rap bgm in between high intensity shots that elevated the experience. Waiting for the second part!!! It better be really good..

This is my first IMDB review!! Just watched it in theatre.

Movie is good. It is of 3h 35 min ( including interval ) . It seems lengthy but story is interesting throughout the period , so no worries for that. It is a adult film , so no kids allowed. It is becz film contains scenes of murders in extreme way ( like crushing a man head till it explodes) but no love or awkard scene at all. It is not action packed, but suspense story with chapter wise description. And next part will be released on march , 2026.

The flow was definitely gripping, and very well made. Beautiful production, extremely well done details, sets, scenes. But where are the real people? Where are the women? Do they smile/cry/sleep and do nothing else - good or bad - on their own beyond their men telling/protecting them? (Even the woman security guard who was shot was distributing sweets for husband's job - that's who they are?) And even the men - where's the humans behind the villains? Are people really that uni-directional, so black and white, either good or bad? Would enjoy more with some feelings and emotions - so many bold characters could reveal so much deep psychological realities.

summary.originalText: A Screen-Filling Fusion of Power and Passion

originalText.plaidHtml: The film's narrative is a slow-burning tension machine, building stakes with intelligence and precision. Ranveer Singh delivers an immersive performance, Sanjay Dutt adds commanding authority, and Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan bring layered, subtle performances. Arjun Rampal's quiet menace maintains tension, and Sara Arjun's emotional moments make the narrative stakes tangible. Aditya Dhar directs with mastery, blending suspense, strategy, and action seamlessly. Cinematography emphasizes both the sprawling cityscape and intimate emotional beats, while the score accentuates tension and drama. The finale is a combination of adrenaline, narrative resolution, and emotional payoff.

summary.originalText: The music matched the movie perfectly, creating a wonderful harmo

originalText.plaidHtml: I really liked this movie! The story was very good, and the music was also amazing. It kept me engaged from start to finish, and I enjoyed every moment of it. The overall experience was fantastic - definitely a must-watch! The music matched the movie perfectly, creating a wonderful harmony."nice job.

From start to finish, the film constructs a high-stakes, emotionally charged world. Ranveer Singh anchors the narrative with a layered performance that conveys both internal conflict and fearless determination. Sanjay Dutt's presence adds authority and danger, while Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan provide thoughtful, nuanced performances. Arjun Rampal's understated menace adds tension, and Sara Arjun's emotionally charged scenes give the story human stakes. Aditya Dhar's direction orchestrates suspense, drama, and high-intensity action seamlessly. Cinematography and score elevate every scene, making the climax both thrilling and emotionally satisfying.

Great Experience with outstanding performances in the movie. Unknown Men the Real Heros of our country depiction stunned me. It shows How should a Spy Thriller Movie to be. The Art Direction and Cinematography are top-notch also editing as well. The key factor of this long time movie which never be feel long because of Background Music also Shaswat did very great job, I am already searching for some songs which are using in it. I witnessed the great performance by All the Actors alongside side characters too. I want to especially mention one Name here Whenever Akshaye Khanna or Rahman Dakait comes on the screen He shine the scene actually outshine Great performance.

Watched it yesterday, and I honestly don't have the words to describe how it made me feel.

Everything - the story, the acting, the plot, the cinematography, the music - is absolutely top-notch.

The way Aditya connects every single dot is just brilliant. Not once did I feel bored or disconnected. The movie holds you completely from start to finish.

Cinematography deserves its own praise. Every frame looks thoughtfully composed, capturing emotions, atmospheres, and symbolism in ways that sometimes say more than dialogues ever could. Combined with a stunning background score, the visual experience becomes even richer. The music never overwhelms the scenes; instead, it elevates them, guiding your emotions without ever dictating them.

Ranveer Singh delivers a powerhouse performance as the mysterious undercover operative at the heart of "Operation Dhurandhar." He brings raw intensity and brooding charisma, reminding us why he's one of Bollywood's most dynamic actors. But the real scene-stealer is Akshaye Khanna as the menacing gangster Rehman Dakait-his chilling mix of vulnerability and ruthlessness is magnetic and elevates every frame he's in.

Direction ossom
Script next level
Acting deserve oscar
Review --- simple plot but execution next level
Ranveer Singh really needs national award for this film he really eats all characters in this film lonely
Akshay kanna sir what an acting sir in emotional scene his tears can control in eyes only woww such an great actor casting wise excellent selection music little better means it could be a woww in theaters that shirani song was mind blowing I enjoyed lot... Overall cinema is good waiting for sequel üëçüèª

I personally loved the movie. The efforts behind the movie is clearly visible. Brilliant cast. Superb acting. The storyline is well integrated with the real life incidents. The intensity of situations is felt thoroughly during the movie. I didn't feel like I was watching a 3.5 hrs movie. I wanted to see more of it. I highly recommend it. After a long time we are seeing something worth watching from Bollywood.

summary.originalText: Where performance becomes power and action becomes art

originalText.plaidHtml: From the first scene, Dhurandhar keeps you hooked. Ranveer Singh is electrifying, bringing his A-game to every intense and emotional scene. Sanjay Dutt is as powerful as ever, giving the film gravitas. Akshaye Khanna, R Madhavan, and Arjun Rampal all deliver performances that feel real and natural. Sara Arjun steals hearts with her innocence. The direction by Aditya Dhar is brilliant, balancing complex political and action-packed scenes with simple storytelling. The film's music, fight sequences, and emotional moments all hit perfectly. A true blockbuster experience.
